DOC.brief_summary: Breast cancer are common on mediterranean basin. Epidemiological data suggest that breast cancer in young women (< 40years old) is more aggressive in the Maghreb countries comparatively to western countries. This aggressiveness could be associated with phenotypic and genotypic differences between this two populations.
DOC.brief_title: Genotype and Phenotype in Early Onset Breast Cancer in Young Women on the Two Shores of the Mediterranean Sea
DOC.detailed_description: The object of this study is to compare the genotypic and phenotypic differences between south and north shore of the mediterranean sea.
DOC.criteria: Patient have or have had a breast cancer diagnosed before 40 years old Breast cancer proven by histology BRCA1/2 analysis proposed, realized, ongoing Women >18 years old Patient with insurance Patient informed and noopposed Patient have or have had a breast cancer diagnosed after 40 years old Patient requiring tutorship or guardianship Adult patient protected by law
